Module org.monarchinitiative.phenol.core
Package org.monarchinitiative.phenol.graph

Interface OntologyGraph<T>

Type Parameters:
T - type of the term/graph node.
All Superinterfaces:
Iterable<T>
public interface OntologyGraph<T> extends Iterable<T>
OntologyGraph is a directed acyclic graph that supports methods required for ontology-related tasks, such as ontology traversals (i.e. getting parents or ancestors of a term OntologyGraph), and tests (subject is parent of object etc.).

The graph has one root term.

All methods that take OntologyGraph as an input throw NodeNotPresentInGraphException in case the node is not a node of the graph.

Author:
Daniel Danis

      Parameters:

    • existsPath

      default boolean existsPath(T subject, T object)
      Test if there is a path from subject to object. In other words, if object is an ancestor of the subject.

      Note: the function is equivalent to calling: 

       getAncestorsStream(subject, false).anyMatch(t -> t.equals(object));
      Returns:
      true if path exists from subject to object and false otherwise.
      Throws:
      NodeNotPresentInGraphException - if the source is not a graph node.

    • isParentOf

      default boolean isParentOf(T subject, T object)
      Return true if the subject is a parent of the object and false otherwise (including if the subject is not in the graph).
      Throws:
      NodeNotPresentInGraphException - if the subject or the object is not a graph node.

    • isAncestorOf

      default boolean isAncestorOf(T subject, T object)
      Return true if the subject is an ancestor of the object and false otherwise (including if the subject is not in the graph)..
      Throws:
      NodeNotPresentInGraphException - if the subject or the object is not a graph node.

    • isChildOf

      default boolean isChildOf(T subject, T object)
      Return true if the subject is a child of the object and false otherwise (including if the subject is not in the graph).
      Throws:
      NodeNotPresentInGraphException - if the object is not a graph node.

    • isDescendantOf

      default boolean isDescendantOf(T subject, T object)
      Return true if the subject is a descendant of the object and false otherwise (including if the subject is not in the graph).
      Throws:
      NodeNotPresentInGraphException - if the subject or the object is not a graph node.
